simsim.core
Class AbstractNode

java.lang.Object
  simsim.core.AbstractNode
All Implemented Interfaces:
MessageHandler
Direct Known Subclasses:
Node, Node, Node
public abstract class AbstractNode
extends java.lang.Object
implements MessageHandler

The base class to extend to create new node types with some specific behavior.

Author:
SÃ©rgio Duarte (smd@di.fct.unl.pt)

Field Detail

endpoint

public EndPoint endpoint
The default endpoint of the node. A node node can use multiple endpoints if needed. Endpoints are used explicitly to send messages and implicitly when a message is received.

address

public NetAddress address
The Network address used to create the endpoints that support message exchange operations for the node. Endpoints are used explicitly to send messages and implicitly when a message is received.

Method Detail

endpoint

public EndPoint endpoint(int port)
Creates new endpoints associated with the node's address, identified by a port number. Allows the node to install a different message handler for each separate endpoint.

Parameters:
port - The port that will be used to identify the new endpoint.
Returns:
The newly created endpoint.

putOffline

public void putOffline()
Puts the node in offline state, unable to send or receive messages.

isOffline

public boolean isOffline()
Returns the online/offline state of the node.

Returns:
Returns the online/offline state of the node.

isOnline

public boolean isOnline()
Returns the online/offline state of the node.

Returns:
Returns the online/offline state of the node.

currentTime

public double currentTime()
Returns the current time in the calling node.

Returns:
The current time in the calling node. If the node does not have its own clock then the system-wide simulation time is returned.

setColor

public void setColor(java.awt.Color c)
Sets the color used to render the node in the simulator window.

Parameters:
c -

getColor

public java.awt.Color getColor()
Returns the current color of the node.

Returns:
The current color of the node.

onSendFailure

public void onSendFailure(EndPoint dst,
                          Message m)
Description copied from interface: MessageHandler
Called when sending a message fails due to the destination endpoint being offline.

Specified by:
onSendFailure in interface MessageHandler
Parameters:
dst - The endpoint that was targeted.
m - The message that failed to reach the targeted node/endpoint.

public void onReceive(EndPoint src,
                      Message m)
Description copied from interface: MessageHandler
Called to process an incoming asynchronous message.

Specified by:
onReceive in interface MessageHandler
Parameters:
src - The source endpoint of the message.
m - The incoming message.

onReceive

public void onReceive(TcpChannel ch,
                      Message m)
Description copied from interface: MessageHandler
Called to process an incoming blocking message.

Specified by:
onReceive in interface MessageHandler
Parameters:
ch - The channel connection that brought the message and identifies its origin.
m - The incoming message.

init

public void init()
Method that needs to be overridden. Place all node initialization code here, including the tasks that implement the behavior of the node.

dispose

public void dispose()
Shutdowns the node. This operation is irreversible. Closes and frees the communication address of this node. No further communication can be sent to or received from this node. Cancels all tasks owned by this node.
